conclusion: Car A comes in from the lower-right edge, travelling roughly toward the centre of the table at a shallow upward-left angle.

Car A's speed is high enough to push a light wooden cube a short distance, but it will slow appreciably after each hit (small spring-powered toy cars do not keep full speed once the wheels leave the starter rail).

premise: Car A is travelling toward the centre of the table at a shallow upward-left angle.
conclusion: The yellow cube is the first obstacle in the direct path of Car A.

conclusion: Distance to the yellow cube is short; no other block sits between the car and the yellow one.

premise: Car A collides with the yellow cube head-on.
conclusion: Impact causes the yellow cube to slide 5–10 cm leftwards; the car loses part of its speed and is turned a few degrees downward (to the driver’s left) by the slight off-centre contact.

premise: Car A is deflected downward-left after colliding with the yellow cube.
conclusion: The new path points straight at the marble sitting just below the yellow cube.

premise: Car A collides with the marble.
conclusion: The marble's density and round shape cause the car to ride up slightly, lose much more speed, and be deflected further downward-left.

premise: Car A is deflected further downward-left after colliding with the marble.
conclusion: The next object in the car's path is the blue cube in the lower-left quadrant.

premise: Car A collides with the blue cube.
conclusion: The hit is gentle; the blue cube shifts a centimetre or two, but the car’s wheels no longer have enough torque to roll farther.

premise: Car A loses all remaining kinetic energy after colliding with the blue cube.
conclusion: Car A settles right beside the blue cube near the lower-left edge of the cloth.

premise: Car A settles beside the blue cube and does not have enough energy to reach other blocks.
conclusion: Car A never reaches the red, green, or purple cubes because each earlier collision bleeds off energy and changes its heading before it could line up with those blocks.

premise: Car A collides with the yellow cube, marble, and blue cube in sequence, and comes to rest beside the blue cube.
conclusion: A will collide, in order, with (1) the yellow cube, (2) the marble, and (3) the blue cube. It will come to rest next to the blue cube in the lower-left part of the table.
